# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia code to solve this problem:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[ -]" => "_")
end
```
This function `clean_column` takes a string as input and returns the cleaned column name. It first converts the entire string to lower case, then strips any leading or trailing whitespaces from both ends of the string using the `strip` function. Then it replaces all spaces and hyphens with underscores using the `replace` function and a regular expression (`r"[ -]"`).

You can call this function like so:
```julia
println(clean_column("My Column"))  # Outputs "my_column"
```
